Non-occurrence of trapped surfaces and Black Holes in spherical gravitational collapse: An abridged version
Abhas Mitra (BARC, Theory Division)
Comments: To be published in the Dec., 2000 issue of Foundation of Physics Letters. Several small changes, more discussion on the nature of Eternally Collapsing Objects (supposed BHs). The problem addressed from 4 directions, (i) Speed of the collapsing fluid must be less than c, (ii) In Sch. coordinates, the metric becomes null on the Event Horizon (EH), (iii) Even in Kruskal coordinates the metric becomes null on the EH, (iv) When crucial errors of Oppenheimer and Snyder paper are removed, they show that trapped surfaces are not allowed
Journal-ref: Found.Phys.Lett. 13 (2000) 543
